alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Williamson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 9:42PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Williamson and Franklin Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 940 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Benton to Thompsonville, moving west southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... West City around 945 PM CDT. Christopher and Valier around 955 PM CDT. Zeigler around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Royalton. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 58 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
